New Records: The White Sox tied the Mets' record with their 20th comeback win of the season, breaking the loss record shared with the 1962 Mets with their 121st loss.
Key Match Events: The game saw a late comeback with back-to-back doubles in the eighth inning and a run-scoring single in the ninth, tying the game before the final out.
Justin Anderson secured his first save of the season, marking the team's 20th save in the year.
Pre-Game Insights: White Sox fans were frustrated with the team's poor performance, chanting 'Sell the team!' and booing wins, reflecting their frustration with the season's struggles.
Post-Match Reflections: Players expressed relief at the unexpected win and acknowledged the fans' disappointment but appreciated the team's resilience.
The win was significant as a rare comeback victory, offering hope for a potential late-season turnaround.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was part of 'Fan Appreciation Week' and 'Dog Day,' with fans bringing their pets to the park.
The announced crowd size was around the team's season average, indicating strong attendance despite a poor season.
Others: The game marked the start of a potential winning streak for the White Sox, though it remains unlikely given their season performance.
